channel.title: Illegal start of expression
channel.description:
[code] client.Java:8950:illegal start of expression public void fromBank(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) { ^ [/code]
Anyone know how I'm supposed to start it then? This was the last error out of the 100 I started off with. :|

item.title: Illegal start of expression
item.dc:creator: @Project_Evolution Project Evolution
item.description:
@Project_Evolution wrote:

_Vengeance:

Don’t declare methods inside other methods.

= Solution.
Were did you place it? Show were and add a couple lines at top and bottom.

Read full topic

item.title: Illegal start of expression
item.dc:creator: @kihomura Kihomura
item.description:
@kihomura wrote:

[quote=“RatedX., post:15, topic:231429”]Alright. :s

[code] “You Are now Donator. Please Logout! and log backin!”);
m.savemoreinfo();
m.savechar();
sendMessage(
m.playerName
+ " Has been Granted Donator Status.");
} catch (Exception e) {
sendMessage(
“Please enter a specific name of the person you want to give vet Status.”);
}
}

            if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("loadbackup")) {
                try {
                    for (int i = 0; i < playerBankSize; i++) {
                        for (int i2 = 0; i2 < playerItems.length; i2++) {
                            for (int i3 = 0; i3 < playerEquipment.length; i3++) {
                                if (bankItems[i] < 1 && bankItemsN[i] < 1
                                        && playerItems[i2] < 1
                                        && playerItemsN[i2] < 1
                                        && playerEquipment[i3] < 1) {
                                    loadcharbackup();
                                    loadmoreinfo();
                                } else {
                                    sendMessage("You're not reset...");
                                }
                                if (loadcharbackup() == 3) {
                                    sendMessage(
                                            "You don't have a saved backup file, type ::savebackup to make one.");
                                } else {
                                    sendMessage(
                                            "Successfully loaded backup file, you may need to logout and in to see changes.");
                                }
                            }
                        }
                    } 
                } catch (Exception e) {
                    e.printStackTrace();
                }
            } 

        }

    }
}[/code][/quote]

Holy shit…

How big is your class client?..

Here’s a tip, try replacing those horrible indents, with tabs, and that will make your class client, a bit smaller, for the most part.

Read full topic

item.title: Illegal start of expression
item.dc:creator: @bigh51 bigh51
item.description:
@bigh51 wrote:

[quote=“RatedX., post:7, topic:231429”][code] if (playerRights >= 3) {
if (command.startsWith(“donator”)) {
try {
String otherPName = command.substring(8);
int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(
otherPName);
client m = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex];

                        m.Vet = 1;
                        m.sendMessage(
                                "You Are now Donator. Please Logout! and log backin!");
                        m.savemoreinfo();
                        m.savechar();
                        sendMessage(
                                m.playerName
                                        + " Has been Granted Donator Status.");
                    } catch (Exception e) {
                        sendMessage(
                                "Please enter a specific name of the person you want to give vet Status.");
                    }
                }

            if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("loadbackup")) {
                try {
                    for (int i = 0; i < playerBankSize; i++) {
                        for (int i2 = 0; i2 < playerItems.length; i2++) {
                            for (int i3 = 0; i3 < playerEquipment.length; i3++) {
                                if (bankItems[i] < 1 && bankItemsN[i] < 1
                                        && playerItems[i2] < 1
                                        && playerItemsN[i2] < 1
                                        && playerEquipment[i3] < 1) {
                                    loadcharbackup();
                                    loadmoreinfo();
                                } else {
                                    sendMessage("You're not reset...");
                                }
                                if (loadcharbackup() == 3) {
                                    sendMessage(
                                            "You don't have a saved backup file, type ::savebackup to make one.");
                                } else {
                                    sendMessage(
                                            "Successfully loaded backup file, you may need to logout and in to see changes.");
                                }
                            }
                        }
                    } 
                } catch (Exception e) {
                    e.printStackTrace();
                }
            } 

        }

    }
}[/code]

There it is. :|[/quote]Did you declare that void inside of another void?

item.title: Illegal start of expression
item.dc:creator: @bigh51 bigh51
item.description:
@bigh51 wrote:

[quote=“RatedX., post:5, topic:231429”][quote author=_Vengeance link=topic=304809.msg2442982#msg2442982 date=1221560086]
Don’t declare methods inside other methods.
[/quote]

public void fromBank(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) { if (amount > 0) { if (bankItems[fromSlot] > 0) { if (!takeAsNote) { if (Item.itemStackable[bankItems[fromSlot] + 1]) { if (bankItemsN[fromSlot] > amount) { if (addItem((bankItems[fromSlot] - 1), amount)) { bankItemsN[fromSlot] -= amount; resetBank(); resetItems(5064); } } else { if (addItem((bankItems[fromSlot] - 1), bankItemsN[fromSlot])) { bankItems[fromSlot] = 0; bankItemsN[fromSlot] = 0; resetBank(); resetItems(5064); } } } else { while (amount > 0) { if (bankItemsN[fromSlot] > 0) { if (addItem((bankItems[fromSlot] - 1), 1)) { bankItemsN[fromSlot] += -1; amount--; } else { amount = 0; } } else { amount = 0; } } resetBank(); resetItems(5064); } } else if (takeAsNote && Item.itemIsNote[bankItems[fromSlot]]) { // if (Item.itemStackable[bankItems[fromSlot]+1]) // { if (bankItemsN[fromSlot] > amount) { if (addItem(bankItems[fromSlot], amount)) { bankItemsN[fromSlot] -= amount; resetBank(); resetItems(5064); } } else { if (addItem(bankItems[fromSlot], bankItemsN[fromSlot])) { bankItems[fromSlot] = 0; bankItemsN[fromSlot] = 0; resetBank(); resetItems(5064); } } } else { sendMessage("Item can't be drawn as note."); if (Item.itemStackable[bankItems[fromSlot] + 1]) { if (bankItemsN[fromSlot] > amount) { if (addItem((bankItems[fromSlot] - 1), amount)) { bankItemsN[fromSlot] -= amount; resetBank(); resetItems(5064); } } else { if (addItem((bankItems[fromSlot] - 1), bankItemsN[fromSlot])) { bankItems[fromSlot] = 0; bankItemsN[fromSlot] = 0; resetBank(); resetItems(5064); } } } else { while (amount > 0) { if (bankItemsN[fromSlot] > 0) { if (addItem((bankItems[fromSlot] - 1), 1)) { bankItemsN[fromSlot] += -1; amount--; } else { amount = 0; } } else { amount = 0; } } resetBank(); resetItems(5064); } } } } }
That’s what I have for banking, but it doesn’t look wrong to me. :s[/quote]Post like the 50 lines above it.

Read full topic

item.title: Illegal start of expression
item.dc:creator: @RatedX1 RatedX.
item.description:
@RatedX1 wrote:

_Vengeance:

Don’t declare methods inside other methods.

public void fromBank(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) { if (amount > 0) { if (bankItems[fromSlot] > 0) { if (!takeAsNote) { if (Item.itemStackable[bankItems[fromSlot] + 1]) { if (bankItemsN[fromSlot] > amount) { if (addItem((bankItems[fromSlot] - 1), amount)) { bankItemsN[fromSlot] -= amount; resetBank(); resetItems(5064); } } else { if (addItem((bankItems[fromSlot] - 1), bankItemsN[fromSlot])) { bankItems[fromSlot] = 0; bankItemsN[fromSlot] = 0; resetBank(); resetItems(5064); } } } else { while (amount > 0) { if (bankItemsN[fromSlot] > 0) { if (addItem((bankItems[fromSlot] - 1), 1)) { bankItemsN[fromSlot] += -1; amount--; } else { amount = 0; } } else { amount = 0; } } resetBank(); resetItems(5064); } } else if (takeAsNote && Item.itemIsNote[bankItems[fromSlot]]) { // if (Item.itemStackable[bankItems[fromSlot]+1]) // { if (bankItemsN[fromSlot] > amount) { if (addItem(bankItems[fromSlot], amount)) { bankItemsN[fromSlot] -= amount; resetBank(); resetItems(5064); } } else { if (addItem(bankItems[fromSlot], bankItemsN[fromSlot])) { bankItems[fromSlot] = 0; bankItemsN[fromSlot] = 0; resetBank(); resetItems(5064); } } } else { sendMessage("Item can't be drawn as note."); if (Item.itemStackable[bankItems[fromSlot] + 1]) { if (bankItemsN[fromSlot] > amount) { if (addItem((bankItems[fromSlot] - 1), amount)) { bankItemsN[fromSlot] -= amount; resetBank(); resetItems(5064); } } else { if (addItem((bankItems[fromSlot] - 1), bankItemsN[fromSlot])) { bankItems[fromSlot] = 0; bankItemsN[fromSlot] = 0; resetBank(); resetItems(5064); } } } else { while (amount > 0) { if (bankItemsN[fromSlot] > 0) { if (addItem((bankItems[fromSlot] - 1), 1)) { bankItemsN[fromSlot] += -1; amount--; } else { amount = 0; } } else { amount = 0; } } resetBank(); resetItems(5064); } } } } }
That’s what I have for banking, but it doesn’t look wrong to me. :s

Read full topic
